resources.string: This feature is only visible for Android 4.2 Jelly Bean MR1 (API 17) or higher.

There are a number of techniques that can be used to reduce energy consumption.

 Accelerating lightly. Acceleration is the strongest contributor to your vehicles energy consumption. Try to avoid unnecessary acceleration by anticipating traffic.
During city driving, avoid complete stops at traffic ligths by letting the vehicle coast and accelerate smoothly at green lights.
 On the motorway maintant a constant speed for optimal efficiency.


Top speeds. At 110 km/h, driving 20km/h faster consumes 25% for energy.


Correct gear. Shift up as soon as possible and avoid high engine speeds.


Auxiliary devices. Auxiliary devices such as heating significantly increase energy consumption in electric vehicles.


Excess weight. The greater the vehicles mass, the higher the energy consumption. Avoid carrying unnecessary extra weight.


Vehicle maintenance. Keep your vehicles in good maintenance and regurlarly check the tire pressure.
Create a charging station at your current location.
Name of charging station e.g. Home
This report compares the average energy consumption of the current month with the previous ones.
This report visualises the number of closed drives, grouped by their length in kilometers.
This report visualises the amount of drives that were driveable, not driveable and drivable if at the beginning of the trip the battery would have been fully charged.
This report visualises the battery state of charge in percent.
"Based on your driving profile, the following vehicle is recommended:"
\nIf you use a different vehicle for N_TRIPS trip(s), the following vehicle will become feasible:\n
"You are doing well on the following eco-driving techniques: "
\nIf you improve your consumption by PERCENT% the following vehicle will become feasible for you:\n
